text: But the idea is much like what, when I'm talking to you now, I don't need to worry about reaching into your brain and changing all the synaptic structures in your, in your brain to make sure you remember what I've told you You do that on your own I'm only providing a very kind of thin stimulus And you do all the hard work of managing the underlying biochemistry in your brain to form memories, make decisions, and so on Same thing here We are not telling the cells what to do We are not talking to the genesis genes or the stem Cells, we provide a very high level signal, build an eye That's it The system being, being a good multi scale cognitive system, it then takes that and does all of the underlying biochemistry that's needed to implement the message that, that we've given them
content_summary: The speaker is drawing a parallel between the process of human communication and memory formation, and cellular communication. He emphasizes that just as humans process and remember information, cells interpret and act on signals without needing explicit instructions for each step of the process.
